statements.statement: Voting is an essential responsibility of every Canadian citizen.
My vote has a meaningful impact on election outcomes.
I feel personally motivated to vote in elections.
People who don’t vote are failing in their civic duties.
I have faced challenges when trying to vote in Canada.
The voting process in Canada is accessible to all citizens.
Online voting would significantly increase voter participation.
Work, childcare, or other logistical issues make it hard for me to vote.
I trust that Canada’s electoral system is fair and transparent.
Politicians represent the interests of ordinary Canadians.
My level of trust in the government directly affects my decision to vote.
Corruption or dishonesty in politics discourages me from voting.
I feel well-informed about candidates and political parties during elections.
Canadians need better education on the importance of voting.
I actively seek information about election issues before voting.
A lack of information about candidates or parties discourages me from voting.
My family and social circle encourage me to vote.
There is a stigma in Canada around not voting.
Cultural or linguistic barriers make it harder for some communities to vote.
Young Canadians are less likely to vote because they feel disconnected from politics.
